Message.Title: IF YOU WANT TO TRY TO MAKE MUCHO BUCKS - CHECK OUT COCO STOCK
Message.Msg: The more i research coco's stock - the more i like it here's why coco should rally now! A lot of improved earnings are expected to cause a massive stampede to buy coco shares. Anticipation of the pending coco rally is building!! coca cola - vs corinthian colleges corinthian college shares -check with your stock advisor and you will swear that coco shares should go higher and higher as we move closer to earning day - august 19th.

Coke will go down by 50% just because the cost of corn sugar is going up 50% this year. Everything they use in drinks and other products use some corn product. The market will take the other 25% so take the loss.

Message.Title: Will It ....
Message.Msg: Split after the close today or mid day?

Remember - No guts, no glory! Coke is the most recognizable brand in the world. You will do fine. The best time to buy a stock is BEFORE it splits BECAUSE THE MAJORITY OF INVESTORS BUY IT AFTER IT SPLITS THEREBY DRIVING THE PRICE UP. Good luck.
Take a look at this also to help belay your concerns... http://www.fool.com/investing/general/2012/08/10/5-star-stocks-poised-to-pop-coca-cola.aspx

Thanks for the fool post. After the basic market surprise rally in recent times there has to be a bit of profit taking, and so, just watch for a final dip now and get back in with more share. Money is flowing from troubled areas in the world and looking for safe places to park, and this is one of them.

Message.Title: Is it a typo??
Message.Msg: Yahoo finance shows next Earnings 12 Aug... reporting Sunday?
It said "Aug 10th" up until today. I think it's some bug or something.
Scratch that -- I was on the wrong board. Sorry about that

Message.Title: EK BONDS TRADING OFF
Message.Msg: http://cxa.gtm.idmanagedsolutions.com/finra/bondcenter/BondDetail.aspx?ID=Mjc3NDYxQVYx&Range=3mo&GraphType=Price Prices are down about 5% of face from 25 to 20 this week. I don't know how... but the bond market always knows something prior to the stock market. If I were to bet , I would think the Auction is not going as well as expected early in the week. Proceeds may be north of a billion but not enough to bail out the stock holders. first 900mm pays off the DIP financing next 575mm pays off secured holders next 500mm other sr holders then 2-2.5 billion for all other creditors. company needs 2-300mm cash for day to day needs. Assets are worth something but how much?? lots of value lost in past 8 months. Bonds trading at 20 cents on the dollar suggest that they might only get 40 cents down the road. Where does that leave the stock holder? I would feel much better if the bonds were trading up this week.

Topic.Title: Quit Asking these Stupid Questions about the Split

Message.Msg: Nice words - compassionate & empathetic. Glad to see human being are still among the posters.

Topic.Title: Quit Asking these Stupid Questions about the Split

Message.Title: So Monday
Message.Msg: It should open at ...??? 39.45? That would be 1/2 of the after hours high, or will Pre Market action on Monday fluctuate where it will open also. Just planning my pricing point to get in on Monday :)

"It should open at ...??? 39.45?" There's no price at which it "should" open. That doesn't mean it won't open at 39.45, though. "That would be 1/2 of the after hours high" Has nothing to do with where it will open. If it does open at 39.45, it won't be because that's half the after hours closing price today. It will open at whatever price someone is willing to pay. One half of today's regular hours closing price will be the basis upon which Monday's gain or loss will be calculated. That's the only thing you can be sure of. ... well, that and death & taxes, of course.
Your wrong.... I can be sure I am going to enjoy this Sam Adams :) Have a good weekend all and Happy Trading come Monday
